intro: Mercurialis alternifolia, commonly known as common mercury, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is an annual or biennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features alternate, palmately lobed leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is adapted to thrive in disturbed soils and can often be found along roadsides and in wastelands. The genus name "Mercurialis" refers to its historical association with mercury, due to the presence of certain compounds in its tissues.
